metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4495 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The send_the_mail function in server/svr_mail.c in Terascale Open-Source Resource and Queue Manager (aka TORQUE Resource Manager) before 4.2.6 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters in the email (-M switch) to qsub.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4495` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtorque2 - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.3ubuntu1
torque-client - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.3ubuntu1
torque-client-x11 - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.3ubuntu1
torque-common - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.3ubuntu1
torque-mom - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.3ubuntu1
torque-pam - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.3ubuntu1
torque-scheduler - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.3ubuntu1
torque-server - 2.4.16+dfsg-1.3ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: torque package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.16+dfsg-1.3ubuntu1').
